metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10108 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Twisted Web through 19.10.0, there was an HTTP request splittingvulnerability. When presented with two content-length headers, it ignoredthe first header. When the second content-length value was set to zero, therequest body was interpreted as a pipelined request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10108` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-twisted - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
python-twisted-bin - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
python-twisted-core - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
python-twisted-mail - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
python-twisted-names - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
python-twisted-news - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
python-twisted-runner - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
python-twisted-web - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
python-twisted-words - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
python3-twisted - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
python-twisted-conch - 1:16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: twisted package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4').
twisted package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4').
